measured_by: Immediate and delayed Word Recall task
justification: “The first task assessed respondents' memory, using an immediate and delayed word recall task… The scores … result in a measure … ‘Word Recall’.”
“The second task assessed semantic verbal fluency, where participants were given one minute to name as many animals as possible… which we refer to as ‘Verbal Fluency’.”
“The third task assessed respondents' working memory… participants were asked to… subtract 7 from 100… The number of correct responses… giving us a measure… ‘Subtraction Test’.”
“The fourth task assessed respondents' fluid reasoning where participants were asked to write down a number sequence… giving us a measure of cognitive function, ‘Fluid Reasoning’.”
“The final task assessed practical numerical knowledge… The final score… provides us with our final measure… ‘Numerical Reasoning’.”

measured_by: Composite score combining the five cognitive tasks
justification: “We also create a composite measure of cognitive function which we refer to as ‘Cognitive Ability’… combining the residualized scores from each of the five cognitive tasks.”
“Personality traits—openness… are measured using the short 15-item Big-Five inventory (BFI-15).”
Same sentence notes Neuroticism is measured with the BFI-15.
Same sentence notes Extraversion is measured with the BFI-15.
Same sentence notes Conscientiousness is measured with the BFI-15.
Same sentence notes Agreeableness is measured with the BFI-15.
